Utterance: <synch>
Hi again! It’s great to see you. How have you been since our last session?
I've been okay, just trying to keep busy, you know?
That's good to hear. Last time, we talked about your goals for getting back to school and working on your graphic design. How has that been going?
Well, I enrolled in a few online courses, so that’s a step forward.
That’s fantastic! How are you finding the courses so far?
They’re challenging, but I’m enjoying it. It feels good to learn again.
That’s great to hear! What’s been the most enjoyable part of the courses for you?
I really like the creative projects. It gives me a chance to express myself.
That’s wonderful. Do you feel like this is helping you manage your stress?
Yeah, I think so. It keeps my mind occupied, which is nice.
I remember you mentioned feeling more at peace when you go back to Mexico. Have you had a chance to think about how you can bring some of that peace into your daily life here?
I’ve been trying to incorporate more music and relaxation time into my routine.
That sounds like a great idea. Music can be very soothing. What kind of music do you enjoy?
Mostly Latin music, but I also like some chill playlists. They help me unwind.
Have you tried any mindfulness or relaxation exercises along with the music?
I haven’t really, but I’m open to it. What do you suggest?
We could start with some simple breathing exercises. They can help ground you when you’re feeling overwhelmed. Would you like to try that now?
Sure, that sounds good.
Great! Let’s take a deep breath in through your nose… and out through your mouth. Let’s do that a few times together.
*breathes in and out*
How do you feel after that?
A bit more relaxed, actually.
That’s wonderful! Incorporating that into your daily routine could help you manage stress better. How do you think you could fit that in?
Maybe in the mornings before I start my day or in the evenings to wind down.
That sounds like a solid plan. You mentioned that you want to work on your temper as well. Have you noticed any situations where it has been a challenge recently?
Yeah, I had a small argument with my girlfriend last week over something silly. I felt my temper rising.
It’s great that you’re aware of that. What do you think triggered that reaction?
I think it was just a combination of stress and feeling overwhelmed with everything I’m trying to manage.
That’s understandable. How did you handle it in the moment?
I took a step back and told her I needed a moment to cool off.
That’s a great technique! Recognizing when you need space is an important step. How did she respond?
She was understanding, which helped a lot.
That’s wonderful to hear. Communication is key in relationships. Have you thought about ways to communicate your feelings before they escalate?
I think I could try to express when I’m feeling overwhelmed before it gets to that point.
That’s a great insight. It’s all about being proactive. How do you think you could practice that?
Maybe I could set aside some time to talk with her about how I’m feeling.
Absolutely! Open dialogue can really strengthen your relationship. What else would you like to work on in our sessions moving forward?
I want to continue focusing on my goals for school and managing my emotions better.
Those sound like solid goals. We can also explore more coping strategies for stress management. How does that sound?
That sounds perfect.
Great! I’m looking forward to our next session. Keep practicing those breathing exercises, and let’s check in on how they’re helping next time.
Will do! Thanks for your help today.
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you soon.
Bye!
